definition: A term commonly employed to express agreement or concession in a conversation, often used to introduce a contrasting or qualifying statement. It is frequently utilized to acknowledge a point made by someone else while adding additional information or expressing a different perspective.

examples.german: Das Essen war gut, allerdings teuer.
examples.english: The food was good, albeit expensive.

examples.german: Ich habe viel gearbeitet, allerdings ohne Erfolg.
examples.english: I worked a lot, though without success.

examples.german: Er ist sehr intelligent, allerdings faul.
examples.english: He is very intelligent, though lazy.

examples.german: Ich wollte kommen, allerdings konnte ich nicht.
examples.english: I wanted to come, but I couldn't.
